text: saying, “Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn Him to death, and shall deliver Him to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall mock Him and shall scourge Him, and shall spit upon Him and shall kill Him. And the third day He shall rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came unto Him, saying, “Master, we would that Thou should do for us whatsoever we shall desire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “What would ye that I should do for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said unto Him, “Grant unto us that we may sit, one on Thy right hand and the other on Thy left hand, in Thy glory.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said unto them, “Ye know not what ye ask. Can ye drink of the cup that I drink of, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Him, “We can.” And Jesus said unto them, “Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized with, also shall ye be baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to sit on My right hand and on My left hand is not Mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus called them to Him and said unto them, “Ye know that they that are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and their great ones exercise authority upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you shall be your minister,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whosoever of you would be the chiefest shall be servant of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even the Son of Man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jericho. And as He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the wayside begging.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace; but he cried out all the more, “Thou Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they called the blind man, saying unto him, “Be of good comfort; rise; He calleth thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he, casting away his garment, rose and came to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, “What wilt thou that I should do unto thee?” The blind man said unto Him, “Lord, that I might receive my sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto him, “Go thy way. Thy faith hath made thee whole.” And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, He sent forth two of His disciples
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto them, “Go your way into the village opposite you, and as soon as ye have entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon man never sat. Loose him and bring him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if any man say unto you, ‘Why do ye this?’ say ye that the Lord hath need of him, and straightway he will send him hither.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went their way and found the colt tied outside by the door at a place where two ways met, and they loosed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of those who stood there said unto them, “What do ye, loosing the colt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded, and they let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought the colt to Jesus and cast their garments on him, and He sat upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many spread their garments upon the way, and others cut down branches off the trees and strewed them upon the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who went before, and those who followed, cried, saying, “Hosanna! Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem and into the temple. And when He had looked round about upon all things, as now the eventide had come, He went out unto Bethany with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the morrow, when they had come from Bethany, He was hungry;
speaker: Narrator

text: and seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, He went to see if perhaps He might find any thing thereon. But when He came to it He found nothing but leaves, for the time for figs was not yet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus spoke and said unto it, “Let no man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.” And His disciples heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jerusalem. And Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He taught, saying unto them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called for all nations the house of prayer’? But ye have made it a den of thieves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy Him; for they feared Him, because all the people were astonished at His doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when evening had come, He went out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter, calling to remembrance, said unto Him, “Master, behold, the fig tree which Thou cursed is withered away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering, said unto them, “Have faith in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For verily I say unto you, that whosoever shall say unto this mountain, ‘Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea,’ and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass, he shall have whatsoever he saith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I say unto you, what things so ever ye desire when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye stand praying, forgive if ye have aught against any, that your Father also who is in Heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in Heaven forgive your trespasses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, there came to Him the chief priests and the scribes and the elders,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto Him, “By what authority doest thou these things? And who gave thee this authority to do these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, “I will also ask of you one question; answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The baptism of John: was it from Heaven, or of men? Answer Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we shall say ‘From Heaven,’ he will say ‘Why then did ye not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we shall say ‘Of men’” — they feared the people, for all men counted John that he was a prophet indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered and said unto Jesus, “We cannot tell.” And Jesus answering, said unto them, “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to speak unto them by parables: “A certain man planted a vineyard, and set a hedge about it, and dug a place for the wine vat, and built a watchtower; and he leased it out to husbandmen and went into a far country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the harvest season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they caught him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he sent unto them another servant, and at him they cast stones, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he sent another, and him they killed, and many others, beating some and killing some.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, ‘They will reverence my son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But those husbandmen said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took him and killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.
speaker: Narrator

text: And have ye not read this Scripture? ‘The stone which the builders rejected has become the head of the corner;
speaker: Narrator

text: this was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sought to lay hold on Him, but they feared the people, for they knew that He had spoken the parable against them. And they left Him, and went their way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sent unto Him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to catch Him in His words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had come, they said unto Him, “Master, we know that thou art true and carest for no man; for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall we give, or shall we not give?” But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, “Why tempt ye Me? Bring Me a penny, that I may see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought it, and He said unto them, “Whose image and superscription is this?” And they said unto Him, “Caesar’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering, said unto them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they marveled at Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came unto Him the Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. And they asked Him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Master, Moses wrote unto us that if a man’s brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, then his brother should take his wife and raise up seed unto his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were seven brethren; and the first took a wife, and dying, left no seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second took her and died, neither leaving any seed. And the third likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the seven had her and left no seed. Last of all the woman died also.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be, for all seven had her for a wife?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering, said unto them, “Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the Scriptures, neither the power of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels who are in Heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And concerning the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spoke unto him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. Ye therefore do greatly err.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that He had answered them well, asked Him, “Which is the first commandment of all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, “The first of all the commandments is: ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength;’ this is the first commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second is like, namely this: ‘Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribe said unto Him, “Well, Master, thou hast said the truth, for there is one God, and there is none other than He.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to love Him with all the heart, with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, He said unto him, “Thou art not far from the Kingdom of God.” And no man after that dared ask Him any question.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said, while He taught in the temple, “How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?
speaker: Narrator

text: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit Thou at My right hand until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: David therefore himself calleth Him ‘Lord’; and whence is He then his son?” And the common people heard Him gladly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them in His doctrine, “Beware of the scribes, who love to go in long clothing, and love salutations in the marketplaces,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts,
speaker: Narrator

text: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus sat opposite the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury. And many who were rich cast in much.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He called unto Him His disciples and said unto them, “Verily I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast more in than all they that have cast into the treasury;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they all cast in of their abundance, but she of her want cast in all that she had, even all her living.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said unto Him, “Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering, said unto him, “Seest thou these great buildings? There shall not be left one stone upon another that shall not be thrown down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked Him privately,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell us, when shall these things be? And what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering them, began to say, “Take heed lest any man deceive you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many shall come in My name, saying, ‘I am Christ!’ and shall deceive many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars, be ye not troubled, for such things must come to pass; but the end shall not be yet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles. These are the beginnings of sorrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But take heed for yourselves, for they shall deliver you up to councils, and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten. And ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for My sake, for a testimony against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gospel must first be proclaimed among all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when then shall lead you and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak; neither need ye premeditate. But whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye; for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against their parents and shall cause them to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall be hated by all men for My name’s sake; but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not be” (let him that readeth understand), “then let them that be in Judea flee to the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter therein to take any thing out of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let him that is in the field not turn back again to take up his garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But woe to them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in those days shall be affliction such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created until this time, neither shall be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved; but for the elect’s sake, whom He hath chosen, He hath shortened the days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if any man shall say to you, ‘Lo, here is Christ!’ or, ‘Lo, He is there!’ believe him not;
speaker: Narrator

text: for false christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall show signs and wonders to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: But take ye heed; behold, I have foretold you all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But in those days, after that tribulation, ‘the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And then shall they see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then shall He send His angels and shall gather together His elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now learn a parable of the fig tree: When her branch is yet tender and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh, even at the doors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass till all these things be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but My words shall not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of that day and that hour knoweth no man — no, not the angels who are in Heaven, neither the Son, but only the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take ye heed, watch and pray; for ye know not when the time is.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is as a man taking a far journey, who left his house and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to watch.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch ye therefore, for ye know not when the Master of the house cometh — at evening, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning —
speaker: Narrator

text: lest coming suddenly, He find you sleeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what I say unto you, I say unto all: Watch!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After two days was the Feast of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take Him by craft and put Him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they said, “Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar of the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard, very precious; and she broke the box and poured it on His head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were some who were indignant within themselves and said, “Why was this ointment wasted?
speaker: Narrator

text: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor.” And they murmured against her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, “Let her alone. Why trouble ye her? She hath wrought a good work on Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have the poor with you always, and whensoever ye will, ye may do them good; but Me ye have not always.
speaker: Narrator

text: She hath done what she could; she hath come beforehand to anoint My body for burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this Gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, this also that she hath done shall be spoken of as a memorial of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests to betray Him unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they heard it, they were glad and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they killed the Passover lamb, His disciples said unto Him, “Where wilt Thou have us go and prepare, that Thou mayest eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sent forth two of His disciples and said unto them, “Go ye into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water; follow him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And wheresoever he shall go in, say ye to the master of the house, ‘The Master saith, “Where is the guestchamber where I shall eat the Passover with My disciples?”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will show you a large upper room furnished and prepared; there make ready for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found it as He had said unto them; and they made ready the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the evening He came with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they sat and ate, Jesus said, “Verily I say unto you, one of you who eateth with Me shall betray Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to be sorrowful and to say unto Him one by one, “Is it I?” And another said, “Is it I?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered and said unto them, “It is one of the twelve that dippeth with Me in the dish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man indeed goeth, as it is written of Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! Good were it for that man if he had never been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they ate, Jesus took bread, and blessed and broke it, and gave it to them and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took the cup, and when He had given thanks He gave it to them, and they all drank of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “This is My blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily I say unto you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine, until that day that I drink it new in the Kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out into the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto them, “All ye shall be offended because of Me this night, for it is written: ‘I will smite the Shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But after I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said unto Him, “Although all shall be offended, yet will I not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto him, “Verily I say unto thee that this day, even in this night, before the cock crows twice, thou shalt deny Me thrice.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter spoke the more vehemently, “If I should die with Thee, I will not deny Thee in any way.” Likewise also said they all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to a place which is named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, “Sit ye here while I shall pray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took with Him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed and very heavy of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death; tarry ye here, and watch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went forward a little, and fell on the ground and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible unto Thee. Take away this cup from Me; nevertheless not what I will, but what Thou wilt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came back and found them sleeping, and said unto Peter, “Simon, sleepest thou? Couldest thou not watch one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again He went away and prayed and spoke the same words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He returned He found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy; neither knew they what to answer Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came the third time and said unto them, “Sleep on now and take your rest. It is enough: the hour is come; behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up; let us go. Lo, he that betrayeth Me is at hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately, while He yet spoke came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that betrayed Him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I shall kiss, that same is he. Take him and lead him away safely.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as he had come, he went straightway to Him and said, “Master, Master!” and kissed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid their hands on Him and took Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of those who stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, “Have ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take Me?
speaker: Narrator

text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took Me not. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all forsook Him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there followed Him a certain young man, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body; and the young men laid hold on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left the linen cloth and fled from them naked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they led Jesus away to the high priest; and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter followed Him afar off, even into the palace of the high priest. And he sat with the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests and all of the council sought for witness against Jesus to put Him to death, and found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many bore false witness against Him, but their witness agreed not together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there arose certain ones who bore false witness against Him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: But neither did their witness agree together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, saying, “Answerest thou nothing? What is it which these witness against thee?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He held His peace and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked Him and said unto Him, “Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, “I am; and ye shall see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes and said, “Why need we any further witnesses?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have heard the blasphemy. What think ye?” And they all condemned Him to be deserving of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some began to spit on Him, and to cover His face, and to buffet Him, and to say unto Him, “Prophesy!” And the servants struck Him with the palms of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Peter was below in the courtyard, there came one of the maids of the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him and said, “And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it, saying, “I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest.” And he went out into the porch, and the cock crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a maid saw him again and began to say to those who stood by, “This is one of them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he denied it again. And a little after, those who stood by said again to Peter, “Surely thou art one of them, for thou art a Galilean, and thy speech agreeth thereto.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he began to curse and to swear, saying, “I know not this man of whom ye speak!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second time the cock crowed. And Peter called to mind the words that Jesus had said unto him: “Before the cock crows twice, thou shalt deny Me thrice.” And when he thought thereon, he wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightway in the morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus and carried Him away and delivered Him to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate asked Him, “Art thou the King of the Jews?” And answering He said unto him, “Thou sayest it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests accused Him of many things, but He answered nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate asked Him again, saying, “Answerest thou nothing? Behold how many things they witness against thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus yet answered nothing, so that Pilate marveled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was one named Barabbas, who lay bound with those who had made insurrection with him, and who had committed murder in the insurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the multitude, crying aloud, began to desire Pilate to do as he had ever done unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Pilate answered them, saying, “Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered Him out of envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, “What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cried out again, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said unto them, “Why, what evil hath he done?” But they cried out the more exceedingly, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged Him, to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers led Him away into the hall called the Praetorium, and they called together the whole detachment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they clothed Him with purple, and they platted a crown of thorns and put it about His head,
speaker: Narrator

text: and began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote Him on the head with a reed and spat upon Him and, bowing their knees, worshiped Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had mocked Him, they took off the purple from Him, and put His own clothes on Him, and led Him out to crucify Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they compelled one Simon, a Cyrenian, the father of Alexander and Rufus, who was passing by, coming from the country, to bear His cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought Him unto the place called Golgotha (which is, being interpreted, The Place of a Skull).
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave Him to drink wine mingled with myrrh, but He received it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had crucified Him, they parted His garments, casting lots for them to see what every man should take.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the third hour when they crucified Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the superscription of His accusation was written above: The King Of The Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with Him they crucified two thieves, the one on His right hand and the other on His left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Scripture was fulfilled which saith, “And He was numbered with the transgressors.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who passed by railed at Him, wagging their heads and saying, “Ah, thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save thyself and come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the chief priests, mocking, said among themselves with the scribes, “He saved others; himself he cannot save!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” And those who were crucified with Him reviled Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he calleth Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one ran and filled a sponge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed and gave it to Him to drink, saying, “Let him alone. Let us see whether Elijah will come to take him down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the centurion who stood opposite Him saw that He so cried out and gave up the ghost, he said, “Truly, this Man was the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also women looking on afar off, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joses, and Salome
speaker: Narrator

text: (who also, when He was in Galilee, had followed Him and ministered unto Him), and many other women who came up with Him unto Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now when the evening had come, because it was the Preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable council member who also was waiting for the Kingdom of God, came and went in boldly unto Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate wondered if He were already dead; and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether He had been any while dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he learned it from the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph bought fine linen, and took Him down and wrapped Him in the linen. And he laid Him in a sepulcher which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulcher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where He was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And very early in the morning on the first day of the week, they came unto the sepulcher at the rising of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said among themselves, “Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulcher?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away, for it was very large.
speaker: Narrator

text: And entering into the sepulcher, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, “Be not afraid. Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen! He is not here. Behold the place where they laid Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go your way. Tell His disciples and Peter that He goeth before you into Galilee. There shall ye see Him, as He said unto you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out quickly and fled from the sepulcher, for they trembled and were amazed; neither said they any thing to any man, for they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven devils.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went and told those who had been with Him, as they mourned and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, believed not.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that, He appeared in another form unto two of them as they walked and went into the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went and told it unto the rest, but neither did they believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward He appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat; and He upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not those who had seen Him after He was risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said unto them, “Go ye into all the world, and preach the Gospel to every creature.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these signs shall follow them that believe: In My name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall take up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them. They shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, He was received up into Heaven, and sat at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went forth and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the Word with signs following. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
